page.title: 11FARMING THE CARTVALE
page.content: The valley of the Cart is{undulating {land}broken by small hedge or tree lined fields.Clay soils produce a good grass for{dairy farming. The largest farm in the area is Flenders Farm run by the Miller family.The farm is 240 acres with 24 acres of silage,60 of hay,35 of barley and the rest is grass.Flenders is a dairy farm with 210 cattle including calves.The farmer gets 16.72p per litre for the milk.He uses many labour saving machines for milking,ploughing, muck spreading and combining.He sells his produce at{Paisley market. Mr.Millar feels that{E.E.C. membership has led to lower prices and quotas for milk.In spite of this he feels farming will continue in his family.The labour force consists of three family members and two others, all full-time and two part-timers.
